## ðŸ”Ž How to search the archive (PDFs) for keywords

Goal: find which past exams mention a term (e.g., Brownian, Sobol, CLT) inside PDF files.

### Mac (Homebrew) / Linux

```bash
brew install pdfgrep
cd /path/to/your/local/repo/assets/tests
pdfgrep -rniH -C2 'your term here' archive/563
```

Examples:
```bash
pdfgrep -rniH -C2 'brownian' archive/563
pdfgrep -rniH -C2 'sobol' archive/563
pdfgrep -rniH -C2 'central limit|CLT' archive/563
```
:::

### Archive

```{python}
#| echo: false
from pathlib import Path
from urllib.parse import quote
from IPython.display import Markdown, display

root = Path("../assets/tests/archive/563")

if not root.exists():
    display(Markdown("*No archived tests found yet.*"))
else:
    pdfs = sorted(root.glob("*.pdf"), key=lambda p: p.name.lower())
    if not pdfs:
        display(Markdown("*No archived tests found yet.*"))
    else:
        lines = []
        for p in pdfs:
            href = "../assets/tests/archive/563/" + quote(p.name)
            label = p.stem.replace("_", " ")
            lines.append(f"- [{label}]({href})")
        display(Markdown("\n".join(lines)))
```
